scenarios.title: Service Refusal and Tenancy
scenarios.description: A tenant stops meeting with their case manager and declines all services for now.
scenarios.question: How should staff proceed?

options.B: Respect the decision; keep support available and separate from tenancy
options.C: Require weekly check‑ins to keep the unit
options.D: Assign property staff to deliver case management

scenarios.explanation: Service engagement is voluntary and separate from tenancy; keep support available without coercion.

scenarios.title: Lease Signing Advocacy
scenarios.description: A landlord proposes a lease addendum requiring participation in services as a condition of tenancy.
scenarios.question: What is the correct response?

options.A: Agree because it supports client stability
options.B: Accept if services are on‑site only
options.C: Decline and advocate for a lease free of service requirements
options.D: Ask property staff to supervise service plans

scenarios.explanation: Tenancy must not be conditioned on services; advocate to remove the requirement.

scenarios.title: On‑Site Space Use
scenarios.description: The only available space for meetings is the property office with foot traffic from residents and staff.
scenarios.question: What is the best plan?

options.A: Proceed there; privacy is not required
options.B: Install cameras in units to avoid office use
options.C: Identify a neutral, confidential space or use community‑based locations
options.D: Conduct meetings at the unit door in the hallway

scenarios.explanation: Meetings should occur in confidential spaces that protect privacy; community‑based options are preferred.

scenarios.title: Boundary Drift
scenarios.description: Property asks the case manager to collect rent while the office is short‑staffed.
scenarios.question: How should the case manager respond?

options.B: Decline and clarify role boundaries; offer to coordinate support for tenants
options.C: Collect rent for on‑site clients only
options.D: Collect rent in exchange for service office space

scenarios.explanation: Collecting rent is a property function; service roles should remain distinct.
